ygData.subject: Re: stuffs
ygData.msgSnippet: Hey Joseph, ... Norrath is ultimately still a very vague society and culture.  I personally prefer to assume that Norrath is a queer positive society, and that
ygData.messageBody:
Hey Joseph,

On Mon, 26 Jul 1999, Joseph J. Normandin wrote:
> Purpose: Created by GLBT citizens of Norrath
> who felt ostracized by norrathian culture (i.e. 12 year old bys who call
> each other homo) who seek to combat ignorance in all fomrs be sustainging a
> guild where all members respect and learn from each other. (something

Norrath is ultimately still a very vague society and culture. I
personally prefer to assume that Norrath is a queer positive society, and
that dumb comment coming from 12 year old boys represent aberations and
not the rule. Why help invent a redneck fantasy universe by placing in
our guild charter that it is so (that we all were ostracized by our home
societies). I'll probably be a wood elf, and I'd like to assume for my
character that wood elves are queer positive.

On the other hand racial hatred is a very definite party of Norrath, with
certain races being KOS by others etc. Now I don't think this is
analagous to human racism. I think a guild mandate of racial unity is
nice from a role playing perspective.

Another thing we could do is claim one of the dieties as a queer diety,
and say we all follow him or her. We could invent our own queer diety.

We could also adopt a less political guild affiliation and just happen to
be mostly queer. I'm going to assume half the citizens of norrath are
queer until a census poll shows otherwise 8)

> should also be said here about how people do not ahve to even really love or
> even like eahc other just respect, that way my high elf wizard can still
> call our dark elf guild members "smelly") maybe we can say: not all of our
> members think, act, or smell alike (har har), nor do they always get along,
> but they always strive for knowledge of the poeples of Norrath.

Lol, yeah that kind of stuff is fun and good for roleplay.

> suggestion: only thing i can think of is that well, mostly we are going
> to be promoting it so it will be motsly us, but dosnt the above suggested
> description not even sound like a GLBT guild???? i dont know i'm confused.
> Its hard to think of a way to balance the fact that we gay peple want a
> guild, but everyone should be able to be in it, and it should amke some
> sense to have it in Norrath.

Well ultimately I think that this guild is supposed to be for GLBT
players, instead of being for GLBT characters. Now, it's not a stretch to
assume that lots of us will be playing GLBT characters, but at least for
me the biggest opportunity is to game with other GLBT players.

In terms of role playing particulars, we can spend as much time as we want
working those out. The guild won't be online for a week or so (it takes
that long).

- Christina
